intro: Acmella grisea, commonly known as the purple spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by vibrant, colorful bracts that serve to attract pollinators. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and covered in fine hairs. Acmella grisea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and unique floral structure.
